intro: Veronica orientalis subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
